lines.text:
[seeing Charlie cleaning his leather-stained feet]
What the hell do you think you're doing?
Washing my feet.
Very biblical. Can you do miracles too?
Yes. I can come back from the dead out of burning Volkswagens.
The old sod owes me an apology.
Sir Henry Cuthbertson, Bart.? No way. I know him, Charlie; he was my godfather long before he was your boss. He's a bastard.
So am I. Funny thing is that none of them realize it.
Well, I won't say be careful, Charlie; no damn sense in that. But remember the first rule.
Always secure an escape route.

[referring to CIA Agent Braley]
I want him there, and always within ten yards.
Ten yards?
You see, at that range I'm classified as an expert shot.

[to Cuthbertson]
You really were incredibly stupid, Sir Henry. Charlie Muffin was one of the few real operatives in your service; his capture of Berenkov was brilliant. Yet you set him up to be shot in Berlin, you vilify him when he comes home unscathed, you demote him.
[smiles]
How can you expect loyalty when you treat a man like that?
World keeping you busy, Charlie?
Well, I think I shall be busy soon enough, sir, yes.
Oh, I say, I hope to God he wasn't briefing you in here! Even panelled walls have ears, you know.

[to Ruttgers]
My only misgiving is that we have to put our faith in two frightened men.
[Ruttgers grunts in agreement]

[looking right at both Directors]
Better two frightened men than two psychopaths.

[referring to Harrison's death]
Why do people always run?
Lack of experience.

[talking about Charlie's affair with Cuthbertson's secretary/goddaughter Janet]
Rutting was always the favorite pastime of the working class.

[to Cuthbertson]
Nothing is impossible when one has the information and the organization.

[to Cuthbertson and Ruttgers]
You must both know that the Soviet Union does not allow its operatives, particularly one so highly regarded, to remain in captivity longer than is absolutely necessary.
[first lines]
So Harrison goes first?
Don't you two have first names? Harrison and Snare, then? Christ, you were at school together!

[they're watching the East-West Berlin crossing station from the East Berlin side]
Looks quiet enough.
Don't be stupid. It's tighter than a duck's bum up there.

[to Kalenin]
If I'd known you had time for relaxation, I'd have invited you to my office.

[to Kalenin]
You got the right car. It just happens you got the wrong man.
If General Berenkov isn't received wih full honors in Moscow reasonably soon, the most stringent Inquiry will be held.
I appreciate that.
But do you appreciate who will be the star witness at that Inquiry? I certainly don't intend that it should be me.

[to Charlie]
You've got a feel about you... the feel of a loser.

[referring to Charlie]
Are you asking me to spy on him?
Yes.

[with a broad smile]
Do I get expenses?

[tight-lipped]
You can charge for "reasonable entertainment".

[Charlie plans to travel to Moscow to meet with Kalenin]
It'll take us more than a week to organize your cover.
*You* organized the cover for Snare and for Harrison. One's dead, the other's in Lubyanka.

[he's just learned Cox will be driving a decoy car]
If we do have to change cars, look in the boot, will you?
Why?
Because a guy's gone out to put a bomb in it.
